citeinfo.origin:
T. Laevastu and R. Marasco
National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC)
citeinfo.title: Marine Mammals and Birds Interactions with Fishery Resources in the Eastern Bering Sea

abstract.p: Two million tons of fish are eaten by marine mammals and birds in the eastern Bering Sea annually. The same amount of fish is taken by the commercial fishery. Annual removal of fish by marine mammals and bird is 4.4 percent of the mean annual standing stock of fish. The consumption of fish by birds is less than 10 percent of consumption by mammals. About half of the fish eaten by mammals are of commercial interest.

descript.purpose: To summarize quantitatively the fisheries and marine mammals interactions.
